summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI regarding a request for travel to conduct witness interviews related to an ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The investigation focuses on allegations involving underage females recruited for sexual activities with Epstein. The document outlines the travel plans and the purpose of the trip.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the FBI investigation involving allegations of sexual activities with underage females.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned as a subject in the investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Eliasib Ortiz Jr
persons.context: Eliasib Ortiz Jr is noted as the approving agent for the communication.

persons.name: Jason R. Richards
persons.context: Jason R. Richards is the agent who drafted the electronic communication.

persons.name: Peter F. Grupe
persons.context: Peter F. Grupe is mentioned as the recipient of the communication in New York.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same FBI investigation involving allegations of sexual activities with minors.
Eliasib Ortiz Jr approved the communication drafted by Jason R. Richards.
Jason R. Richards is communicating with Peter F. Grupe to request travel for witness interviews.

events.title: Investigation Opened
events.description: The FBI opened an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein involving allegations of sexual activities with underage females.

events.title: Travel for Witness Interviews
events.description: FBI agents plan to travel to New York to conduct witness interviews and serve target letters.

keyFacts: The FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein involves allegations of recruiting underage females for sexual activities.
The minors involved were reportedly paid between $200.00 and $1,000.00 after engaging in sexual activities.
The document outlines a planned travel from Miami to New York for the purpose of interviewing witnesses and serving target letters.
